title: Advancing Effective, Accountable Policing and Criminal Justice Practices To Enhance Public Trust and Public Safety

enrichment.summary: This executive order directs federal agencies to improve policing and the broader criminal justice system by increasing transparency, accountability, and community trust. It sets standards for law enforcement recruitment, use-of-force policies, data collection, officer wellness, and supports alternatives to incarceration and better reentry services. It also restricts the transfer of certain military equipment to local police and promotes the use of body cameras and technology with privacy safeguards.
potential_concerns: Implementing new data collection and accountability systems may burden smaller law enforcement agencies with limited resources.
Privacy concerns could arise around the use and public availability of sensitive law enforcement misconduct and use-of-force data.
Restrictions on military equipment transfers may face resistance from law enforcement agencies asserting operational needs.
Balancing transparency with due process protections for officers in accountability databases could provoke legal challenges.
Efforts to address systemic racism and bias through training and policies may generate political and community controversy.
